[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The E-commerce System (ECS) defines requirements for online shopping, order processing, secure transactions, and customer engagement.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: ECS enables customers to browse, purchase, track, and return products while integrating with payment and logistics services.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: ECS integrates with payment gateways, inventory management, logistics providers, and customer review platforms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: ECS provides a web-based and mobile-friendly UI for customers, sellers, and administrators.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: ECS supports barcode scanners for order fulfillment and POS terminals for in-store purchases.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: ECS connects with third-party APIs for payments, shipping, and product recommendations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: ECS ensures secure data exchange via TLS encryption and two-factor authentication.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: ECS optimizes storage for product catalogs, transaction histories, and customer preferences.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: ECS automates order processing, inventory tracking, promotions, and customer notifications.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: ECS supports multiple currencies, languages, and region-based product listings.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: ECS connects with third-party loyalty programs, return management systems, and fraud detection tools.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: ECS supports product discovery, cart management, checkout, order tracking, and returns processing.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: ECS serves customers, sellers, delivery agents, and support staff across multiple geographies.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: ECS depends on third-party payment gateways and logistics providers for fulfillment.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: ECS requires payment provider agreements, regulatory compliance, and marketplace partnerships.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Cart: Temporary product selection before checkout.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with payment processors and shipping carriers for order fulfillment.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow users to TO-BE-DEFINED (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall allow users to modify shopping cart contents before checkout.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall enable discount application and provide order tracking (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-004: The system shall support product returns and refunds through an automated request process.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive UI with clear navigation for searching, purchasing, and order tracking.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall return search results in 2 seconds and support 10,000 users.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store product details, order history, and transaction records.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with PCI DSS standards for secure payment processing.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to data privacy laws, including GDPR and CCPA.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall implement fraud detection, secure checkout, and encrypted data storage (REQ-DSGN-001).

[SEC] 3. Verification: Transaction security checks, order fulfillment accuracy, and load testing ensure reliability.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, API docs, and marketplace integration.
[SEC] 5. References: PCI DSS compliance, GDPR regulations, and e-commerce best practices.
